intro: Eremoluma, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Eremoluma thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
